column2: So the Brahman and the Tiger walked on till they came to a Banyan tree; and the Brahman said to it: "Banyan Tree, Banyan Tree, hear and give judgment." "On what must I give judgment?" asked the Banyan Tree.
column3: So the Brahman and the Tiger walked on till they came to a Banyan tree; and the Brahman said to it: "Banyan Tree, Banyan Tree, hear and give judgment." "On what must I give judgment?" asked the Banyan Tree.

column2: Let the Tiger eat the man, for men are an ungrateful race."
column3: Let the Tiger eat the man, for men are an ungrateful race."

column2: After a little while they met a camel.
column3: After a little while they met a camel.

column2: At a little distance they found a bullock lying by the roadside.
column3: At a little distance they found a bullock lying by the roadside.

column2: Is it fair that he should do so or not?"
column3: Is it fair that he should do so or not?"

column2: The Bullock said: "When I was able to work my master fed me well and tended me carefully, but now I am old he has forgotten all I did for him, and left me by the roadside to die.
column3: The Bullock said: "When I was able to work my master fed me well and tended me carefully, but now I am old he has forgotten all I did for him, and left me by the roadside to die.

column2: Let the Tiger eat the man, for men have no pity."
column3: Let the Tiger eat the man, for men have no pity."

column2: The Brahman stated the case, and the Eagle answered: "Whenever men see me they try to shoot me; they climb the rocks and steal away my little ones.
column3: The Brahman stated the case, and the Eagle answered: "Whenever men see me they try to shoot me; they climb the rocks and steal away my little ones.

column2: Let the Tiger eat the man, for men are the persecutors of the earth."
column3: Let the Tiger eat the man, for men are the persecutors of the earth."

column2: But the Alligator said: "Whenever I put my nose out of the water men torment me and try to kill me.
column3: But the Alligator said: "Whenever I put my nose out of the water men torment me and try to kill me.

column2: The Brahman gave himself up as lost; but again he prayed the Tiger to have patience and let him ask the opinion of the sixth judge.
column3: The Brahman gave himself up as lost; but again he prayed the Tiger to have patience and let him ask the opinion of the sixth judge.

column2: Exactly there, was it? asked the Jackal.
column3: Exactly there, was it? asked the Jackal.

column2: How do you mean? said the Jackal; "how were you within the cage? which way were you looking?" "Why, I stood so," said the Tiger, jumping into the cage, "and my head was on this side." "Very good," said the Jackal, "but I cannot judge without understanding the whole matter exactly.
column3: How do you mean? said the Jackal; "how were you within the cage? which way were you looking?" "Why, I stood so," said the Tiger, jumping into the cage, "and my head was on this side." "Very good," said the Jackal, "but I cannot judge without understanding the whole matter exactly.

column2: Was the cage door open or shut?" "Shut and bolted," said the Brahman.
column3: Was the cage door open or shut?" "Shut and bolted," said the Brahman.
